sen.j: 箕作 元八（みつくり げんぱち、文久2年5月29日 (旧暦)（1862年6月26日）- 大正8年（1919年）8月9日）は、江戸生まれの歴史学者。
sen.e: Genpachi MITSUKURI (June 26, 1862 - August 9, 1919) was a historian originated in Edo, present-day Tokyo.
Genpachi MITSUKURI (June 26, 1862 - August 9, 1919) was a historian who was born in Edo (present-day Tokyo).
Genpachi MITSUKURI (June 26, 1862 - August 9, 1919) was a historian who was born in Edo (present-day Tokyo).

sen.j: 東京大学動物学科卒。
sen.e: Mitsukuri graduated from Zoology Department of the University of Tokyo.
Mitsukuri graduated from the Zoology Department of the University of Tokyo.
Mitsukuri graduated from the Zoology Department of the University of Tokyo.

sen.j: 留学先のドイツフライブルク大学で近眼のため顕微鏡を使うのに困難を感じ、西洋史学の研究に転向した。
sen.e: He went to study at University of Freiburg in Germany, but he felt difficulty in handling microscopes due to his nearsightedness, so he converted his research theme to Western world history.
sen.cmt: 「西洋史」：以後頻出しますが、定訳では多少冗長になりがちなので以後"Western world history"に統一します
sen.e: He then went on to study at the University of Freiburg in Germany, but he found handling microscopes difficult due to his nearsightedness, so he changed his research field to Western world history.
He then went on to study at the University of Freiburg in Germany, but he found handling microscopes difficult due to his nearsightedness, so he changed his research field to Western world history.

sen.j: ハイデルベルク大学・テュービンゲン大学などでハインリヒ・フォン・トライチュケやレオポルト・フォン・ランケの指導を受け1891年（明治24年）テュービンゲン大学で博士号取得。
sen.e: Supervised by German historian such as Heinrich von Treitschke and Leopold von Ranke in University of Heidelberg, University of Tubingen, etc., Mitsukuri finally received his doctorate from University of Tubingen in 1891.
sen.cmt: 「テュービンゲン大学」：英文に突然ドイツ語正式名が出てくるのは違和感がありますので、前出のフライブルク大学と同じく英語通称を採用しました
sen.e: Supervised by German historians such as Heinrich von Treitschke and Leopold von Ranke at the University of Heidelberg, University of Tubingen, and the like, Mitsukuri received his doctorate from the University of Tubingen in 1891.

Supervised by Heinrich von Treitschke and Leopold von Ranke at the University of Heidelberg, University of Tubingen, and the like, Mitsukuri received his doctorate from the University of Tubingen in 1891.
sen.cmt: German historians such asは原文にない情報ですので削除しました。

sen.j: 1892年（明治25年）に帰国。
sen.e: Mitsukuri went back to Japan in 1892.
Mitsukuri went back to Japan in 1892.
Mitsukuri went back to Japan in 1892.

sen.j: 高等師範学校教授となり、1893年（明治26年）には第一高等中学校教授となる。
sen.e: He became a professor at Higher Normal School, then in 1893 he gained his position as a professor of Daiichi Koto Chugakko (the first High School).
sen.cmt: 「教授」：この場合はポジション名ですので定訳（「教え授けること」の訳）では不適
sen.e: He became a professor at Higher Normal School, and then in 1893, he gained his position as a professor of Daiichi Koto Chugakko (the first High School).
sen.cmt: 接続詞を追加しました。
sen.e: He became a professor at Higher Normal School, and then in 1893, he gained his position as a professor of Daiichi Koto Chugakko (the first High School).

sen.j: 更に1900年（明治33年）から翌年にかけてフランスなどに留学し、政治史やフランス革命の研究にあたる。
sen.e: He again went to study in France and other countries in 1900-1901 to develop his research about political history and the French Revolution.
In addition, he went to study in France and other countries in 1900-1901 to develop his research on political history and the French Revolution.
In addition, he went to study in France and other countries in 1900-1901 to develop his research on political history and the French Revolution.

sen.j: 帰国後の1902年（明治35年）、東京大学教授となり近代フランス史を講義。
sen.e: After Mitsukuri returned to Japan, he began to teach modern French history as a professor of the University of Tokyo in 1902.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Mitsukuri returned to Japan, he began to teach modern French history as a professor of the University of Tokyo in 1902.
After Mitsukuri returned to Japan, he began to teach modern French history as a professor of the University of Tokyo in 1902.

sen.j: 『西洋史講話』や『仏蘭西大革命史』、『ナポレオン時代史』などを著しながら、西洋史研究の重要性を歴史学界に認めさせた功績は大きい。
sen.e: Writing books such as "Seiyo-shi Kowa (A Lecture on Western World History)", "Furansu Daikakumei-shi (History of the Great French Revolution)" and "Naporeon Jidai-shi (History of Napoleon Era)", Mitsukuri made a remarkable contribution to the community of historians to let them recognize the significance of the study of Western world history.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Writing books such as "Seiyoshi Kowa" (A Lecture on Western World History), "Furansu Daikakumeishi" (History of the Great French Revolution)" and "Naporeon Jidaishi" (History of Napoleon Era), Mitsukuri made a remarkable contribution to the community of historians to let them recognize the significance of the study of Western world history.
sen.cmt: クオテーションマークの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: Writing books such as "Seiyoshi Kowa" (A Lecture on Western World History), "Furansu Daikakumeishi" (History of the Great French Revolution)" and "Naporeon Jidaishi" (History of Napoleon Era), Mitsukuri made a remarkable contribution to the community of historians to let them recognize the significance of the study of Western world history.

sen.j: 脳溢血のため58歳で急死した。
sen.e: Mitsukuri suddenly died of a cerebral hemorrhage at age 58.
Mitsukuri suddenly died of a cerebral hemorrhage at the age of 58.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: Mitsukuri suddenly died of a cerebral hemorrhage at the age of 58.

sen.j: 箕作秋坪の四男で、母つねは箕作阮甫の三女。
sen.e: Genpachi is the fourth son of Shuhei MITSUKURI, while Genpachi's mother Tsune is the third daughter of Genpo MITSUKURI.
Genpachi was the fourth son of Shuhei MITSUKURI, while Genpachi's mother Tsune was the third daughter of Genpo MITSUKURI.
sen.cmt: 次の文章に合わせ過去形にしました。
sen.e: Genpachi was the fourth son of Shuhei MITSUKURI, while Genpachi's mother Tsune was the third daughter of Genpo MITSUKURI.

sen.j: 数学者の菊池大麓及び動物学の箕作佳吉は元八の兄にあたる。
sen.e: Dairoku KIKUCHI, a mathematician, and Kakichi MITSUKURI, a zoologist, were the elder bothers of Genpachi.
Dairoku KIKUCHI, a mathematician, and Kakichi MITSUKURI, a zoologist, were the elder bothers of Genpachi.
sen.cmt: スペースを調整しました。
sen.e: Dairoku KIKUCHI, a mathematician, and Kakichi MITSUKURI, a zoologist, were the elder bothers of Genpachi.

sen.j: みつ夫人（進十六の娘）との間に2男3女をもうけ、長男・箕作秋吉は理学博士号を持つ化学者であると同時に作曲家としても活躍し、次男・洋輔は工業技術家として知られた。
sen.e: Mitsukuri and his wife Mitsu who was the daughter of 進十六 had two sons and three daughters: the first son, Shukichi MITSUKURI, was a chemist with a Doctorate of Science, and also was a composer; the second son, Yosuke, was known as an industrial technician.
sen.cmt: 「進十六」は読み方が不明でした。参考URL:「全国の苗字」（http://www2s.biglobe.ne.jp/~suzakihp/index40.html）
sen.e: Mitsukuri and his wife Mitsu (a daughter of 進十六) had two sons and three daughters: the first son, Shukichi MITSUKURI, was a chemist with a Doctorate of Science, and also was a composer; the second son, Yosuke, was known as an industrial technician.
sen.cmt: 進十六の娘の所を変更しました。
sen.e: Mitsukuri and his wife Mitsu (a daughter of 進十六) had two sons and three daughters: the first son, Shukichi MITSUKURI, was a chemist with a Doctorate of Science, and also was a composer; the second son, Yosuke, was known as an industrial technician.

sen.j: また長女・綾子は医学者で眼科の権威・甲野謙三に、次女・縫子は矢野矢に、三女・歌子は堀田嘉幸に嫁いだ。
sen.e: The first daughter, Ayako, married Kenzo KONO who was a medical scientist and an expert of ophthalmology; the second daughter Nuiko and the third daughter Utako married 矢野矢 and Yoshiyuki HOTTA, respectively.
sen.cmt: 「矢野矢」は読み方が不明でした。
sen.e: The first daughter, Ayako, married Kenzo KONO who was a medical scientist and an expert of ophthalmology; the second daughter Nuiko and the third daughter Utako married 矢野矢 and Yoshiyuki HOTTA, respectively.

The first daughter, Ayako, married Kenzo KONO who was a medical scientist and an expert of ophthalmology; the second daughter Nuiko and the third daughter Utako married 矢野矢 and Yoshiyuki HOTTA, respectively.

sen.j: 吉阪隆正の妻・富久子は甲野謙三・綾子夫妻の娘である。
sen.e: A wife of Takamasa YOSHIZAKA, Fukuko, was a daughter of Kenzo and Ayako KONO.
A wife of Takamasa YOSHIZAKA, Fukuko, was a daughter of Kenzo and Ayako KONO.
A wife of Takamasa YOSHIZAKA, Fukuko, was a daughter of Kenzo and Ayako KONO.

tit.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 西洋史綱 峯岸米造共著 六盟館, 1899
sen.e: Seiyo-shi Ko (Introduction to the Western World History), coauthored with Yonezo MINEGISHI, Rokumei-kan, 1899
sen.cmt: 原文に『』がないので指示書に従い""は省略。以下同様

Seiyo-shi Ko (Introduction to the Western World History), coauthored with Yonezo MINEGISHI, Rokumei-kan, 1899

Seiyo-shi Ko Yokai (Summary of Introduction to the Western World History), Rokumei-kan, 1899
Seiyo-shi Ko Yokai (Summary of Introduction to the Western World History), Rokumei-kan, 1899
